cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the South Carolina coast near Charleston/Georgetown, then forecast to slow, turn north-northeast, and track just inland across southeastern North Carolina before emerging offshore and accelerating northeastward along the coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (around Georgetown/Charleston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from the Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC (does not include NC coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina coast and the southeastern North Carolina coast (including Cape Fear region)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts to tropical-storm force (39-45 mph) possible late Sunday through Monday as the center passes nearby inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1 ft above normal tide possible near inlets; major inundation not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible in persistent rainbands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend.
